header.title: 14 Remarkable Pictures Of British Tattoo Enthusiasts, Seen With And Without Their Clothes
header.author: Lynzy Billing

li.title: 1. Stefano, from London
li.comment: I pretty much love every inch of my skin for different reasons, but I love my back because I’ve been waiting for 17 years to get it done, and it’s come out exactly as I wanted it.

li.title: 2. James, from Brighton
li.comment: I was 16 and got a small lizard on my hip. My parents asked, how would I ever get a job?

li.title: 4. Ness, from Sussex
li.comment: I’m loving how [the tattoos] change as my body gets older and the creases and wrinkles change how they look.

li.title: 5. Dan, from Bexleyheath
li.comment: What age do I think I’ll stop getting inked ? Never.

li.title: 6. Darren, from Crawley
li.comment: I love my tattoos – if you don’t like them, don’t look at them. Who cares how I’ll feel when I’m old?

li.title: 7. Patrick, from Brighton
li.comment: My first tattoo was at 13 and was a secret for 10 years. It’s a part of me and I am not going to get old.

li.title: 8. Lilianna, from Coventry
li.comment: I don’t feel my opinion will change on my tattoos. I doubt I’ll have any regrets regardless of my age.

li.title: 9. Uno, from Hastings
li.comment: I’m beyond the stopping point now. It fucking hurts like shit, man, but I wouldn’t change my look for the world.

li.title: 11. Izzy, from Aylesford
li.comment: I love being different, and every day I’m asked about them at least once, always getting a positive reaction. Good tattoos aren’t cheap, cheap tattoos are not good.

li.title: 12. Kenny, from West Drayton
li.comment: I love my tattoos – it’s a way of life for me and I’ll carry on getting them for as long as I can. Via Kenny

li.title: 13. Kimmy, from Ruislip
li.comment: My Kiss tattoos are my favourites – the pain was incredible but it feels good to show my ultimate dedication to the band.

li.title: 14. Gareth, from Potters Bar, Hertfordshire
li.comment: Alan Powdrill is still looking for models to take part in this tattoo photo project, Covered. You can reach him on Twitter.
